itemDesc: Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa or less commonly Oryza glaberrima.
Wheat is a member of the grass family that produces a dry, one-seeded fruit commonly called a kernel.
Sugar is the generic name for sweet-tasting, soluble carbohydrates, many of which are used in food.
SAlt is the generic name for salt-tasting, soluble carbohydrates, many of which are used in food. It is salty in nature.
Chili powder is the dried, pulverized fruit of one or more varieties of chili pepper, sometimes with the addition of other spices.
Garam masala is a blend of ground spices originating from South Asia.It is common in Indian, Pakistani, Nepalese and Bangladeshi.
